publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3285 Mr Kenny MacAskill: An Impartial Service?—That the Parliament notes with concern the implications of the opening of National Archives of Scotland file, SEP 10/556, for the perception of an impartial civil service; notes that for 30 years the British state concealed a report by Professor Gavin McCrone that strongly supported the economic case for independence, and calls for an assurance from the Scottish Executive that it has never used the civil service to try and undermine any political party or movement in the partisan way that the Scottish Office and Cabinet Office used the civil service to try and undermine the Scottish National Party in 1975. Supported by: Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Alex Neil*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Linda Fabiani*, Fiona Hyslop*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-3285 An Impartial Service? (lodged on 14 September 2005) Christine Grahame*, Tricia Marwick*, Jim Mather*, Stewart Stevenson*, Fergus Ewing*, Brian Adam*, Richard Lochhead*, Rob Gibson*, Bruce Crawford*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Adam Ingram*
